cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest along the Florida east coast today, then turning north and northeast offshore Georgia toward the Carolinas and the mid-Atlantic states Monday-Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: likely along the South-North Carolina coast late Monday night or early Tuesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northeast Florida coast northward through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible with peak sustained winds 35–45 mph and higher gusts Monday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible along the northeast Florida coast and lower St. Johns River, including Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts; mainly brief heavy squalls
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado threat shifts north of the port after Monday
